word_mean: 肌肉：通过收缩能使动物体运动的器官，可分两类，一类为横纹肌，包括所有可随意收缩的肌肉及心肌
另一类为非横纹肌或称平滑肌，包括所有不随意肌(心肌除外)，例如肠道、膀胱、血管等的肌层。横纹肌为一薄层结缔组织即肌外衣(epimysium)所覆盖，由此发出许多隔膜，即肌束衣(perimysium)进入肌肉将其分隔成许多肌束，每一肌束含有许多平行之肌纤维，各肌纤维间有结缔组织隔，即肌内衣(endomysium)
每一肌纤维含有肌浆(sarcoplasm)，肌浆有横纹，由交替的明带和暗带构成
包括皮毛、腠理深部的现代解剖学意义上的皮下脂肪、肌肉等组织，具有保护内脏与相关组织，抵御外邪，主司运动等功能。

sentence.Network_cn: 这样可能会导致身体虚弱和肌肉萎缩。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from French, from Latin musculus, diminutive of mus 'mouse' (some muscles being thought to be mouse-like in form)

encyclopedia.content: 肌肉（muscle）主要由肌肉组织构成。 肌细胞的形状细长，呈纤维状，故肌细胞通常称为肌纤维。中医理论中，肌肉指身体肌肉组织和皮下脂肪组织的总称。司全身运动。脾主肌肉，肌肉的营养从脾的运化水谷精微而得。

entry.def: A muscle is a piece of tissue inside your body which connects two bones and which you use when you make a movement.

example.ex: Keeping your muscles strong and in tone helps you to avoid back problems...
example.tran: 保持肌肉强壮发达有利于预防背部疾病。

example.ex: He is suffering from a strained thigh muscle...
example.tran: 他的大腿肌肉拉伤了，疼得很。

entry.def: If you say that someone has muscle, you mean that they have power and influence, which enables them to do difficult things.

example.ex: Eisenhower used his muscle to persuade Congress to change the law...
example.tran: 艾森豪威尔用他的影响力说服国会修改了该项法律。

example.ex: In one town, all the women were urged to remove their money from the banks on an allotted day, to demonstrate women's financial muscle.
example.tran: 在某市，所有的女性都被建议在指定日期从银行取走她们的钱，以展示女性群体的经济实力。

entry.def: If a group, organization, or country flexes its muscles, it does something to impress or frighten people, in order to show them that it has power and is considering using it.

example.ex: The Fair Trade Commission has of late been flexing its muscles, cracking down on cases of corruption.
example.tran: 公平交易委员会最近在显示威力，严厉打击腐败事件。

entry.def: If you say that someone did not move a muscle, you mean that they stayed absolutely still.

example.ex: He stood without moving a muscle, unable to believe what his eyes saw so plainly.
example.tran: 他站在那里一动不动，不能相信眼前如此清清楚楚看到的一切。

means.word_mean: 1. one of the contractile organs of the body
2. animal tissue consisting predominantly of contractile cells
3. a bully employed as a thug or bodyguard;

sentences.sentence: "the druglord had his muscleman to protect him"

means.word_mean: 4. authority or power or force (especially when used in a coercive way);

sentences.sentence: "the senators used their muscle to get the party leader to resign"
"He muscled his way into the office"

sentences.en: When you bend your elbow, you contract the muscles of the arm.
sentences.cn: 你屈肘时, 手臂的肌肉就会收缩。

sentences.en: Lifting weights will build arm and shoulder muscles.

jushi.english: It'll take a lot of muscle to move this piano.
jushi.chinese: 搬动这架钢琴得花很大的力气。

jushi.english: Those large companies carry a great deal of political muscle.
